DataElement.preferredName: ARACNE Algorithm Programming Parameter Mean Filter java.lang.Double
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An information-theoretic algorithm for reverse engineering of transcriptional networks using microarray data, specifically designed to scale up to the complexity of regulatory networks in mammalian cells, yet general enough to address a wider range of network deconvolution problems, while eliminating the majority of indirect interactions inferred by co-expression methods.:A value that is passed to a routine._The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.:A higher-order function which takes a predicate and a list and returns those elements of the list for which the predicate is true. It is a means of narrowing the scope of a report by specifying ranges or types of data to include or exclude._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

It is a means of narrowing the scope of a report by specifying ranges or types of data to include or exclude.

Concepts.definition: An information-theoretic algorithm for reverse engineering of transcriptional networks using microarray data, specifically designed to scale up to the complexity of regulatory networks in mammalian cells, yet general enough to address a wider range of network deconvolution problems, while eliminating the majority of indirect interactions inferred by co-expression methods.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.:A higher-order function which takes a predicate and a list and returns those elements of the list for which the predicate is true. It is a means of narrowing the scope of a report by specifying ranges or types of data to include or exclude.

Concepts.definition: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

A higher-order function which takes a predicate and a list and returns those elements of the list for which the predicate is true. It is a means of narrowing the scope of a report by specifying ranges or types of data to include or exclude.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
